key_title: Key to the genera of Menyanthaceae

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons

source.author: Aston, H.I.
source.title: Menyanthaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Aston, H.I. (1999). Menyanthaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Flowers in spaced pairs or in clusters along horizontal usually floating stems; side-wings of corolla-lobes laciniate; capsules mostly indehiscent and submerged, sometimes dehiscing by valves on plants on mud
Flowers in open panicles on erect to semi-erect stems; side-wings of corolla-lobes entire; capsules aerial, opening by 4 apical valves

Leaves erect or floating, mostly about as broad as long, often strongly dorsiventral; flowers homostylous; capsule ovoid-ellipsoid, adnate to the calyx-tube only at the base; seed mostly 1–1.5 mm long, smooth or tuberculate, without a caruncle

Leaves erect, usually much longer than broad, matt and more or less isolateral; flowers heterostylous; capsule subglobular to broad-ellipsoid, the lower third to half adnate to the calyx-tube; seed large, mostly 1.7–2.6 mm long, mostly sparsely to densely tuberculate (tubercles to 0.3 mm long), with a conspicuous circular caruncle
